required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Willingness to Participate in a Trial Comparing Standard Genetic Counseling Versus Personalized Genetic Counseling
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluate Willingness to Participate in a Trial Comparing Standard Genetic Counseling Versus Personalized Genetic Counseling Based on LFSPRO-ShinyApp Data

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates patients willingness to participate in a trial comparing standard genetic counseling versus personalized genetic counseling. Collecting information from patients may help researchers learn why patients may or may not take part in the future study that compares standard genetic counseling to personalized genetic counseling.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
I. To evaluate patients' willingness to participate in a future randomized trial comparing standard genetic counseling versus personalized genetic counseling based on Li-Fraumeni syndrome patient reported outcome (LFSPRO) ShinyApp data.
OUTLINE:
Patients complete a questionnaire over 15-20 minutes. Patients positive for a TP53 mutation complete an additional questionnaire over 15-20 minutes within 1 month after test results.

primary_outcome.measure: Patient willingness to participate in a future randomized trial comparing standard genetic counseling versus personalized genetic counseling based on LFSPRO ShinyApp data
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year

arm_group.description: Patients complete a questionnaire over 15-20 minutes. Patients positive for a TP53 mutation complete an additional questionnaire over 15-20 minutes within 1 month after test results.

study_pop.textblock: Receive receiving genetic counseling specifically for TP53 genetic testing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals age 15 or older OR parent/guardian of a patient younger than 15 years (if age 15-17, the patient will provide assent and parent/guardian will provide consent)
- English fluency
- Receive genetic counseling specifically for TP53 genetic testing and who consent to undergo TP53 genetic testing OR individuals whose genetic testing indicates a TP53 germline mutation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals who are non-English speaking
- Individuals having low suspicion for a TP53 germline mutation during pretest counseling and test negative for a TP53 mutation
